thread.title: Photocentric to launch Liquid Crystal 3D printer at TCT Show
thread.title_full: Photocentric to launch Liquid Crystal 3D printer at TCT Show

title: Photocentric to launch Liquid Crystal 3D printer at TCT Show
text:
Photocentric to launch Liquid Crystal 3D printer at TCT Show 24 September 2015 Expand Photopolymer specialist, Photocentric is set to launch its new Liquid Crystal 3D printer and range of photopolymer resins at TCT Show + Personalize next week. 
The new machine benefits from patented Daylight Polymer Printing (DPP) technology and allows users to produce large volume prints at a fraction of the cost of current machines. The Liquid Crystal is solely LCD and combines a 10-inch, high resolution LCD screen and specially formulated resins for a high-quality, low-cost 3D printing solution. 
Priced at just £499, this simple machine aims to open up 3D printing to more designers, artists and engineers by providing an accessible solution for high-resolution 3D printed objects. 
Visitors can learn more about the Liquid Crystal on stand H28 at TCT Show + Personalize on 30 th Setpember – 1 st October 2015 at the NEC, Birmingham. Visitors can register for free and gain access to the show floor and packed conference agenda. Tags
